intro: Brachystelma vartakii, commonly known as the Vartakii ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, where it thrives in full sun. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pale pink or white, adding a delicate touch to its rugged appearance. Brachystelma vartakii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
